text: being put on trial for the initial
charges I was acquitted by a jury and
that made the prosecutor insane they
went after me with the death penalty and
gave me a three-day murder trial at the
age of 20 and I had no chance
I hated myself I hated who I been I
hated that I let a childhood incident of
being attacked and sexually abused make
me a drug addict
man I ruined all my chances Victoria and
I felt so ashamed when I went to prison
and I felt God gave me a reason to live
and an officer took pity on me and let
me have some books in her cell than a
man committed suicide in and I began
educating myself and 10,000 books later
I felt like I had mastered myself when I
went to trial at the age of 20 everyone
spoke over me as if I was an ignorant
Pig when I was fighting for DNA in 1989
I educated the court on mitochondrial
DNA
I was far more advanced in my self than
the man who'd sent me to death row
well my brother Michael was still alive
he was having a seizure at my mother's
feet when I called her he was badly
injured as a young man and he was an
alcoholic and addicted to fit and my
younger brother had already died of
oxycontin and so my mother said oh my
god I'm so happy that you can come home
but please let me just have one of my
son's live the 12 years of my life since
release have been harder than all the
death row years why do you say that
because it's so hard to be a nice man
when you lose so much and I strive very
hard to be a very polite and nice person
for reason and I do apologize I'm very
sorry you don't have to apologize our
audience is very very very compassionate
I recognize that I have a purpose
I offer hope and good to people who
struggle in their lives
